chunk_analysis.page_text:
THIS INDENTURE, Made the fourth day of November, in the year of our Lord one thousand nine hundred and sixteen,

BETWEEN W. H. King and Gertrude O. King, his wife, of Blacksville, West Virginia, D.L. King and Daisy M. King, his wife, A. R. King and Elizabeth King, his wife, Francina King, widow of John King, deceased, and EMMA WILLIAMS and S. T. Williams, her husband, all of Waynesburg, Greene County, Pennsylvania, S. R. King and Elizabeth King, his wife, of Wayne Township, Greene County, Pennsylvania, R. F. King and Kate King, his wife, of Clarksburg, West Virginia, L. R. Renner of McCurray, Pennsylvania, and Clara Ingram and Ray Ingram, her husband of Morris Township, Greene County, Pennsylvania, parties of the first part, and T. J. Wise, of Wayne Township, Greene County, Pennsylvania, party of the second part;

WITNESSETH, that the said parties of the first part, for and in consideration of the sum of fifty eight hundred and two and fifty-five one hundredths ($5802.55) Dollars, lawful money of the United States of America, unto them well and truly paid by the said party of the second part, at and before the sealing and delivery of these presents, the receipt whereof is hereby acknowledged, have granted, bargained, sold, aliened, enfeoffed, released, conveyed and confirmed, and by these presents do grant, bargain, sell, alien, enfeoff, release, convey and confirm unto the said party of the second part, his heirs and assigns,

All that certain tract of land situated in Wayne Township, Greene County, Pennsylvania, bounded and described as follows:

BEGINNING at a stone at corner of lands of John Kuenn and lands of Kuenn and Ritenbaugh, thence along line of said land of Kuenn and Ritenbaugh and land of Hamilton Longsrreth South twenty two (22) minutes and thirty seven (37) seconds East fourteen hundred and twenty nine and seventy four one hundredths (1429.74) feet to a stake at corner of Purpart 2 of the Partition at No. 3, September Term, 1915, Common Pleas Court of Greene County, Pennsylvania; thence along line of said Purpart 2 South eighty nine (89) degrees and thirty one (31) minutes West twenty seven hundred and thirteen and forty one one hundredths (2713.41) feet to a stake on line of land of Andrew Stewart; thence along line of said land of Andrew Stewart North fifty three (53) minutes West fourteen hundred twenty nine and seventy seven hundredths (1429.77) feet to a stake on line of land of John Kuenn; thence North eighty-Nine (89) degrees thirty one (31) minutes East twenty-seven hundred twenty six and four tenths (2726.4) feet to the place of BEGINNING.

CONTAINING eighty nine and twenty seven hundredths (89.27) acres, strict measure, per survey made February 23, 1915, by T. H. Dinmore, C. E.

EXCEPTING AND RESERVING to the parties of the first part, their heirs and assigns, all the coal in and underlying said land, together with free and uninterrupted right of way into, upon and under said land, at such points, and in such manner as may be proper and necessary for the purpose of digging, mining, coking, and carrying away all of said coal, and the privilege and easements necessary and proper for the convenient draining, ventilating, depositing waste and operating the mines, hereby waiving all damages sustained therefrom or thereon, or from the removal of all the said coal; together with the privilege of mining and removing through said described premises, other coal belonging to said parties of the first part, their heirs and assigns; or which may hereafter be acquired, by the parties of the first part, their heirs and assigns.

EXCEPTING AND RESERVING to the parties of the first part, their heirs and assigns, all the oil and gas in and underlying said land, together with the exclusive right to enter thereon for the purpose of drilling or operating thereon for oil and gas, to erect, maintain and

[Note: The text appears to be cut off at the end of the page]
